Title: Kat McDonough goes head-to-head with the defense in a murder trial
Description: McDonough testified for 10 days during Seth Mazzaglia's murder trial and would paint the final picture of the last night of Lizzi Marriott’s life.

Title: Remembering Lizzi Marriott
Description: Tony and Becky Hanna share favorite memories of their niece, Lizzi Marriott, and what it was like when she moved in with them.

Title: "Thief": Lizzi Marriott's prophetic poem
Description: Melissa and Bob Marriott talk about their daughter, Lizzi, and how they want people to know the Lizzi that they knew - a beautiful, talented and effervescent young woman whose absence continues to be a heavy burden for her loved ones to bear.

Title: Accused killer Seth Mazzaglia's theatre audition
Description: Watch Seth Mazzaglia’s audition for a production of "A Midsummer Night’s Dream."  Wait until  the end for a truly interesting death scene.

Title: Star witness Kat McDonough acts out
Description: Watch Kat McDonough's audition for a production of "A Midsummer Night’s Dream," which was in rehearsals in October 2012, when Lizzi Marriott went missing. For more, watch " Dangerous Games," Saturday, Sept. 19 at 10/9c on CBS.

Title: "48 Hours" visits the spot where Lizzi Marriott's body was last seen
Description: Correspondent Troy Roberts  reports from the Piscataqua River, which has one of the fastest tidal currents in North America.  Teams searched this area for months and never found a trace of the 19-year-old University of New Hampshire student. What happened to Lizzi Marriott? Roberts has the story Saturday at 10/9c on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: Dangerous Games
Description: A bright college student lured into the world of bondage and domination by a friend. She said no -- and didn’t survive the night. Was it murder? Troy Roberts investigates Saturday, Sept. 19 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Dangerous Games
Description: All new: A bright college student lured into the world of bondage and domination by a friend. She said no -- and didn’t survive the night.  Was it murder? Troy Roberts investigates Saturday, Feb. 14 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Mark Castellano's confession
Description: Houston Police Detective Fil Waters sat with Mark Castellano for hours to gain his trust. Watch how the seasoned detective gets Castellano to crack and confess to murdering his ex-girlfriend, Michelle Warner.

Title: The art of the interrogation
Description: Detective Fil Waters and Sergeant Brian Harris of the Houston Police Department talk to Correspondent Tracy Smith about the strategies they used to get Mark Castellano to confess to murdering his ex-girlfriend, Michelle Warner.

Title: "48 Hours" goes one on one with Mark Castellano
Description: Mark Castellano gives "48 Hours" correspondent Tracy Smith a glimpse into the mind of a killer.

Title: Dr. Phil on Mark Castellano: "The interview's a lie"
Description: It was TV's Dr. Phil McGraw -- not Houston police - who would first interrogate Mark Castellano about Michelle Warner's mysterious disappearance. Correspondent Tracy Smith traveled Los Angeles to get McGraw's psychological breakdown of the suspected killer.

Title: Using FaceTime to help solve a case
Description: "48 Hours" correspondent Tracy Smith on the clever use of technology by Houston detectives investigating the disappearance of  young mother Michelle Warner. For the rest of the story, watch "Gone,"  Saturday, April 2 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: "48 Hours" sneak peek: Gone
Description: A Texas man tells Dr. Phil he’s desperate to find his missing ex-girlfriend. 48 hours later, he tells police something different. Where’s the truth? Tracy Smith investigates Saturday, April 2 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: "48 Hours" preview: Gone
Description: All new: A Texas man tells Dr. Phil he’s desperate to find his missing girlfriend. 48 hours later he tells police something different. Where’s the truth? Tracy Smith investigates Saturday, Feb. 7 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: A millionaire's downfall in photos
Description: Former model Monica Olsen provides "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts with a window into her tumultuous marriage to millionaire Dino Guglielmelli.

Title: A hired hit caught on tape
Description: When millionaire Dino Guglielmelli sat down for lunch with alleged hit man Richard Fuhrmann, he had no idea his hired gun was wearing a wire. Guglielmelli's entire murder-for-hire plot was caught on tape.

Title: Sneak peek: The Millionaire, the Model & the Hit Man
Description: A millionaire is willing to shell out $80,000 to have someone kill his model wife. What could possibly go wrong? "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts investigates  Saturday, Aug.  13 at 9 p.m.  ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: The Millionaire, the Model and the Hit Man
Description: A millionaire is willing to shell out $80,000 to have someone kill his model wife. What could possibly go wrong? "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts investigates Saturday, Jan. 31 at 10 p.m.  ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Friend shares texts from Alix Tichelman sent days before her arrest
Description: Todd, one of Tichelman' s closest friends, reveals never-before-made-public text messages between the two.  He tells "48 Hours" why Tichelman arranged to meet another "sugar daddy" on an online dating site and why that meeting did not go as she planned.

Title: Texts show Alix Tichelman was trying to "get her act together"
Description: In February 2014, three months after the death of Google exec Forrest Hayes, Alix Tichelman's friend, Todd, says the heroin addict was trying to turn her life around.

Title: Family: An innocent connection to Michele Harris?
Description: Greg and Shannon Taylor, Michele Harris' brother and sister-in-law, discuss a frequent customer at the restaurant where Michele worked, who the defense says should be looked at more seriously.

Title: Family on Michele Harris' missing jewelry
Description: Greg and Shannon Taylor, Michele Harris' brother and sister-in-law, discuss the importance of one piece of Michele's jewelry and whether finding it would change their minds about the case.

Title: Sneak peek: Kiss of Death and the Google Exec
Description: The mysterious death of a Google executive and his last night with an exotic beauty captured on video -- now a court decides her fate. "48 Hours" correspondent Maureen Maher updates the case Saturday, July 30  at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: The destructive force of fire in a crime scene investigation
Description: "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts on how a fire at a home in Pinyon Pines, Calif., likely destroyed evidence of a triple murder.

Title: Sister reads one of Becky Friedli's last postings on social media
Description: Drew Friedli recites a poem her sister, Becky, left on Myspace, before her murder in 2006. Drew feels the poem, "If I Knew It was the Last Time," encompasses who Becky was because she always let people know that she loved them.

Title: Preview: Murder in Pinyon Pines
Description: A triple murder -- a young woman set afire in a wheelbarrow. Will this haunting clue close the case? Troy Roberts investigates Saturday, Jan. 17 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours " double feature
Description: Saturday at 8 p.m. ET/PT: An apparent suicide in a Pennsylvania church exposes secrets a twice-widowed pastor wants to keep hidden. Then, all new at 10 p.m. ET/PT: A triple murder -- a young woman set afire in a wheelbarrow. Will this haunting clue close the case?

Title: From fighting crime to making BBQ sauce
Description: Now retired from the North Carolina State Bureau of Investigation, former special agent Steve Modlin is busy making barbecue sauce with his wife on their North Carolina farm.

Title: Vanessa Mintz' commitment to her community
Description: In 2008, Vanessa Mintz brought the ATHENA Award to Henderson County, N.C., to honor local women leaders making a difference in the community.

Title: N.C. murder case exposes a tangled web of deceit
Description: Correspondent Peter Van Sant discusses the murder of a beloved mother and local leader in Saluda, N.C., that shocked the quiet town. He says interviewing her family was "as powerful a moment as [he's] ever experienced" on "48 Hours." Watch "The Ultimatum" Saturday, Aug.  8 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Remembering Vanessa Mintz
Description: Three years after her death, Mintz' friends gathered with her family to share their special memories of the woman with the "contagious laugh." For more on what happened to Mintz, watch "The Ultimatum," Saturday, Aug. 8 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: The Ultimatum
Description: Two daughters are determined to find their mother’s killer. Will the investigation expose hidden secrets? "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant reports Saturday, Aug. 8 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Spree killer Levi King: Were signs missed?
Description: "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty reflects on Levi King’s past behavior. King is responsible for murdering families in Texas and Missouri.

Title: A child's call for help
Description: On Sept. 30, 2005, 10-year-old Robin Doan made a chilling call to 911 after being awakened by an intruder who broke into her rural Texas farmhouse and shot her family.

Title: Sneak peek: Sole Survivor
Description: A young girl plays dead to live through a shooting that destroyed her family -- and describes her remarkable story of survival. Erin Moriarty reports in "48 Hours" Live to Tell Saturday, March 5 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: The Dog Trainer, the Heiress and the Bodyguard
Description: "48 Hours" Presents: A celebrity dog trainer is murdered, an heiress fears for her life, and a bodyguard is determined to be a hero. "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant reports Saturday, Dec. 27 starting at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: The propaganda war in Cuba fizzles out
Description: When America put signs up ridiculing communism in Cuba, the island's government fought back to block them from sight. Now, as Scott Pelley reports, the old propaganda battles seems to no longer matter.

Title: Suspect's bizarre outburst stuns courtroom
Description: Todd Winkler's murder trial in Placerville, Calif., had barely gotten under way, when it was brought to a grinding halt by a bizarre outburst from the defendant. For more, watch "The Two Faces of Todd Winkler," Saturday, Dec. 12 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: "She came at me with a 'V' of scissors"
Description: Todd Winkler waived his right to an attorney and spoke to investigators for more than an hour on Feb. 27, 2012, the day he killed his wife, Rachel. Winkler gave them his version of the events that led to her death -- beginning with an argument over their impending divorce.

Title: Crime scene manipulation? Todd Winkler on the moments after killing wife
Description: During questioning for the murder of Rachel Winkler, her husband, Todd, told detectives of his efforts to resuscitate her -- and what he decided to do next. "48 Hours" correspondent Richard Schlesinger has more on the case Saturday, Dec 12 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Todd Winkler surrenders after killing wife
Description: In audio recorded by El Dorado County Sheriff's deputies on Feb. 27, 2012, Todd Winkler is heard describing the alleged fight that led to the death of his wife, Rachel, as well as where they could find her body. "48 Hours" has more on the story in "The two faces of Todd Winkler, airing Saturday, Dec. 12 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Benji Novack murder: Hiring the hit men
Description: Former Miami Beach homicide detective Joe Matthews shows "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts the unique location where the men who killed Benji Novack were hired.

Title: Benji Novack: Batman collector
Description: Benji Novack lived a lavish lifestyle, and splurged on everything related to one of his childhood idols. He had one of the largest collections of Batman memorabilia in the world.

Title: Cristobal Veliz speaks from jail
Description: Cristobal Veliz called "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts from jail to proclaim his innocence in the murder of his brother-in-law Benji Novack. He blames Alejandro Garcia, Joel Gonzalez and other co-conspirators for the murder.

Title: Benji Novack's mistress speaks out
Description: In an exclusive interview, Benji Novack's mistress, Rebecca Bliss, tells "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts about their relationship.

Title: Life at the fabulous Fontainebleau
Description: In the 1960s, the lavish Miami Beach hotel attracted the likes of JFK and Frank Sinatra. Michael Aller, a director of tourism for Miami Beach, shares tales of the glory days of the famous Fontainebleau Hotel.

Title: Sneak peek: Crazy Love
Description: SPECIAL TIME: A brat, a Batman collector, filthy rich and dead. Who killed Miami hotel heir Benji Novack? Troy Roberts reports Saturday, Dec. 6 at 9/8c on CBS. [Pre-empted on the West Coast due to NCAA Football]

Title: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: SPECIAL TIME: Saturday at 8/7c: Why would a man confess to killing his 14-year-old cousin if he didn’t do it? Then at 9/8c:  A brat, a Batman collector, filthy rich and dead - who killed Miami hotel heir Benji Novack?

Title: Mystery surrounds apparent suicide of Ohio State athlete
Description: A preliminary autopsy shows an Ohio State University football player died from a gunshot wound to the head, but questions continue to swirl around Kosta Karageorge's apparent suicide. Don Dahler reports on the autopsy's findings.

Title: For the Mendez family, a lineage of performers
Description: The parents of Karla Brada, Hector and Jara Mendez, discuss the long legacy of performing in their family, and how they remember their daughter through a shared love of music.

Title: Reporter's notebook: Addiction and domestic violence
Description: Correspondent Maureen Maher takes you behind the reporting of this week's  "48 Hours" and discusses the sensitive, but serious topics of addiction and domestic violence. For more, Watch "the Sober Truth," Saturday, Jan. 2 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: The Sober Truth
Description: A young woman, an alcoholic, thought she found help and a safe place -- what she found was a killer. "48 Hours" correspondent Maureen Maher reports Saturday, Jan. 2 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: The Sober Truth
Description: All new:  A young woman, an alcoholic, thought she found help and a safe place -- what she found was a killer. Maureen Maher reports Saturday, Nov. 29 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Interrogation: Tracey Grissom on what happened after she shot her ex-husband
Description: During questioning, Tracey Grissom says that she emptied her gun firing at her ex-husband, Hunter Grissom. She says she always thought "he'd kill me."

Title: Investigators question Tracey Grissom
Description: A sobbing Tracey Grissom tells an officer with the Tuscaloosa Sheriff's Office why she pulled up to her ex-husband's job site and about the "mean" look he gave her before she pulled the trigger.

Title: Dash cam captures Tracey Grissom arrest
Description: A dashboard camera records a deputy with the Tuscaloosa Sheriff's Office responding to the crime scene and captures Tracey Grissom's arrest. For more on the story watch "The Girl Next Door" Saturday, July 18 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Witness calls 911 after Hunter Grissom shooting
Description: William Dockery calls 911 after witnessing his boss, Hunter Grissom, get shot four times in Northport, Alabama, on  May 15, 2012.  Dockery says Hunter told him to "call the law" just before the first shot was fired. For more, watch "The Girl Next Door" Saturday, July 18 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Tracey Grissom calls 911 after fatally shooting her ex-husband
Description: Tracey Grissom calls 911 after she shot and killed her ex-husband,  Hunter Grissom, in Northport, Alabama, on May 15, 2012.  In the emotional call, she tells the 911 operator that she "couldn't take it no more." Watch "The Girl Next Door" Saturday, July 18 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: A picture may tell more than just one story
Description: Tracey Grissom, a young mother charged with killing her ex-husband, told "48 Hours"'  Erin Moriarty that she acted in self-defense and is a domestic abuse victim – with the pictures to prove it. But, as Moriarty reports, there may be more to a story – and a photo --than first appears. For more, watch "The Girl Next Door" Saturday, July 18 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: The Girl Next Door
Description: All new: A man shot dead - the shooter was his ex-wife. Did she fire in self-defense or did she plan to kill? Erin Moriarty reports Saturday Nov. 22 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Bruce Beresford-Redman's prison diary
Description: In a video diary made for "48 Hours," Beresford-Redman explains what he has to do to survive in Mexican prison from day to day.

Title: Burgos sisters remember their murdered sister
Description: In a 2012 interview with "48 Hours," Jeanne and Carla Burgos spoke with Troy Roberts about their sister, Monica Beresford-Redman, and brother-in-law Bruce. Bruce Beresford Redman was convicted of Monica's murder on March 12, 2015.

Title: A mother's video diary
Description: Bruce Beresford-Redman’s mother, Juanita, documents the challenges of life on the home front as her son, now convicted of murder, sits  a Mexican prison.

Title: Search for missing American takes "48 Hours" to Panama
Description: Who's behind the disappearance of Yvonne Baldelli? Correspondent Peter Van Sant previews "48 Hours"' three-year odyssey to find out what happened to the Southern California woman who moved to Central America with the man of her dreams – and never returned. Watch "Devil's Island" Tuesday,  June 23 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Surviving Mexican prison
Description: Former "Survivor" producer Bruce Beresford-Redman shows "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts around the Mexican prison where he has been held for more three years. He was convicted of the 2010 murder of his wife, Monica, in March 2015.

Title: Sneak peek: Prison Diaries
Description: All new: A reality-show producer on trial for murdering his wife turns the camera on himself inside a Mexican prison.Troy Roberts reports Saturday, Nov. 15 at 8 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: Devil's Island
Description: All new: An ex-Marine with a secret life has a girlfriend who goes missing in Panama – was it murder? "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant investigates Saturday, Nov. 15 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: A Marine trained in ballet
Description: Preview: In this excerpt from a report by correspondent David Martin, Amy Wolfe, mother of a young Marine killed in Iraq in 2006, talks about how the athleticism of her son's ballet training shaped his ability to serve in the armed forces.

Title: "48 Hours" preview: Nov. 15 double feature
Description: All-new: Saturday, Nov. 15 starting at 8 p.m. ET/PT: A reality-show producer on trial for murdering his wife turns the camera on himself inside a Mexican prison.Then at 10: An ex-Marine, a secret wife and a missing girlfriend -- was it murder?

Title: Angela Rose finds solace from trauma in music
Description: The attack survivor says putting her feelings to music can be can be therapeutic.

Title: Walter Shelley juror: Brown's testimony was key
Description: On Sept. 13, 2013, Walter Shelley was found guilty of first-degree murder. His one-time friend, Edward Alan Brown, was the key witness against him. This time jurors believed Brown's confession that he was there when Shelley and Michael Ferreira killed John McCabe. Another jury acquitted Ferreira on nearly the same testimony and evidence.

Title: Juror in Michael Ferreira trial unsettled by verdict
Description: On Jan. 25, 2013, Michael Ferriera was acquitted of the murder of John McCabe. A juror tells "48 Hours" he thought Ferreira was "partially responsible" for the teen's death, but fellow jurors did not find witness Edward Alan Brown credible.

Title: Preview: The Pact
Description: All new: A 15-year-old boy goes to a dance and never returns. Teen killers keep a secret for 40 years – until one of them cracks. Richard Schlesinger investigates Saturday, Oct. 25 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: When time is the enemy in solving crime
Description: "48 Hours"' Richard Schlesinger on how time worked against police in solving John McCabe’s murder in 1969. With new DNA technology, cell phones and advanced CSI techniques, a case like McCabe's would likely be solved very quickly today. Watch "The Pact" Saturday, Oct 25 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Justice denied: Why do so many rapists roam free?
Description: Correspondent Maureen Maher reflects on the cases of Angela Rose and Delaney Henderson - featured in this week's "48 Hours" Live to Tell --  and why most sexual assault cases are never prosecuted.  For more on their stories, watch " I Remember Everything," airing Saturday, June 25 at 8 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: I Remember Everything
Description: "48 Hours" Live to Tell: Kidnapped at knifepoint, a young woman outsmarts her attacker. Maureen Maher reports Saturday, June 25 at  8 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: The Pact
Description: A 15-year-old boy goes to a dance and never returns. Teen killers keep a secret for 40 years – until one of them cracks. Richard Schlesinger investigates Saturday, Oct. 31 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: Two all-new mysteries Saturday, Oct. 25 starting at 9 p.m. ET/PT: Up first, kidnapped at knifepoint, a young woman outsmarts her attacker -- and lives to tell her story.  Then at 10  p.m. ET/PT: A 15-year-old boy goes to a dance and never returns. Teen killers keep a secret for 40 years – until one of them cracks.

Title: Police question Salt Lake City mother about alleged abuse of former female student
Description: Watch as Det. Berch Parker of the Contra Costa Sheriff's Office questions Julie Correa about her interactions with a former student, Kristen Cunnane. Cunnane says Correa – her former teacher and coach -- sexually abused her for more than three years when Cunnane was in high school.

Title: Protecting students from sexual abuse by teachers and coaches
Description: Tips and suggestions from three people who have a lot of experience in the arena of teacher-student sexual abuse and the Kristen Cunnane case. A lawyer, prosecutor and investigative reporter tell you what you need to look out for.

Title: Former student confronts her alleged abuser – a trusted gym teacher and coach
Description: In January 2014, Jamie Carrillo, 28, videotaped herself as she phoned her former teacher and coach, Andrea Cardosa. Watch as Carrillo confronts the woman about her alleged abuse – and what happened as a result.

Title: Sexual abuse of students by teachers, coaches an "epidemic"
Description: The problem of teachers sexually abusing their students seems to be in the headlines more and more these days. But, as attorney Dave Ring tells "48 Hours"' Tracy Smith, it's not necessarily a new problem.

Title: Sports and violence go hand in hand, even down to middle school
Description: Even in this era when big-time sports stars are accused of violent behavior, it is still shocking that sexual abuse and rape -- and even extensive cover-ups -- extend all the way down to high school and middle school. The sad truth is that it is happening and many of the abusers are coaches preying sexually on their athletes.  Saturday, June 20 on "48 Hours,"  Tracy Smith will highlight one of these stories and the extent of the coach’s obsession will likely shock you.

Title: Sneak peek: Kristen's Secret
Description: A former middle school athlete kept quiet about years of abuse by a trusted coach. Can she now get the woman to admit to her crimes? Tracy Smith reports  for "48 Hours" Saturday, June 20 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Toyota recalls over 400,000 cars in U.S.
Description: The move is part of a worldwide recall involving more than 1.6 million vehicles. A possible flaw in the fuel delivery pipes of Lexus models has caused Toyota to issue the U.S. recall. Norah O'Donnell reports.

Title: Connecticut police shoot and kill man stabbing people on bus
Description: A man who stabbed two people on a tour bus was shot and killed by Connecticut police Tuesday night. The incident shut down a section of Interstate 95, the biggest highway in the Northeast. Charlie Rose reports.

Title: Ex-wife on Gary Triano's massive gambling debts, fear
Description: In her first and only television interview, Pam Phillips talks to "48 Hours"' Peter Van Sant about her former husband's multimillion dollar gambling debts and the abuse she says she suffered during their marriage.

Title: Preview: Kristen's Secret
Description: All new: A former middle school athlete kept quiet about years of abuse by a trusted coach. Can she now get the woman to admit to her crimes? Tracy Smith reports in an all-new "48 Hours" Saturday, Oct. 18 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Tucson detective links suspects in Gary Triano murder
Description: Det. James Gamber of the Pima County Sheriff's Dept., talks to Peter Van Sant about the evidence he believes shows that Pamela Phillips and Ronald Young were involved in more than just a casual business relationship.

Title: Pam Phillips on her "rich and famous" lifestyle
Description: In her first and only television interview, Pam Phillips talks to "48 Hours"' Peter Van Sant about her past as a jet-setting socialite.

Title: "48 Hours" behind the scenes: How to film a car bombing
Description: Correspondent Peter Van Sant takes you to an explosives range in New Mexico,  where ATF agents recreated the bomb used in the notorious 1996 murder of Tucson entrepreneur Gary Triano. "48 Hours" used eight cameras to capture the blast.

Title: Sneak peek: The Hit
Description: "48 Hours" Presents: Why was a colorful entrepreneur with powerful friends blown up in his car? His ex-wife speaks out to correspondent Peter Van Sant Saturday, May 27 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: The Hit
Description: All new: Why was a colorful entrepreneur with powerful friends blown up in his car? His ex-wife speaks out for the first time to "48 Hours"' Peter Van Sant Saturday, Oct. 11 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS

Title: Kevin Cooney testifies in defense of his mother
Description: Prosecutor Shanon Clowers cross-examines Kevin Cooney, who appears in court as a defense witness in his mother's 2014 trial for his attempted murder. Clowers questions Cooney about contradictions in his earlier testimony about where the gun was positioned when it went off, shooting him in the neck.

Title: Karina Taylor on her career in Mixed Martial Arts
Description: Kevin Cooney's ex-girlfriend, Karina Taylor, invites "48 Hours" correspondent Richard Schlesinger into "the cage" to learn more about how she got into MMA fighting.

Title: Cooney case: A story you need to see to believe
Description: Correspondent Richard Schlesinger reflects on some of the questions he raised in this week's "48 Hours,"  "Mommy Dearest," airing Saturday, Dec. 31 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: GossipExtra.com's Jose Lambiet on Palm Beach society
Description: What's it like living and working in one of the playgrounds of the rich and famous? Gossip columnist  Jose Lambiet, who has been covering Palm Beach society for 22 years, takes "48 Hours"' Richard Schlesinger for a drive around town.  Find out why they are there Saturday at 10/9c on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: Mommy Dearest
Description: A Palm Beach socialite kills her ex-husband and serves no time. Twenty years later, with the same gun,  another family member is shot. "48 Hours" correspondent Richard Schlesinger investigates Saturday, Dec. 31 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Hong Kong protesters digging in
Description: Pro-democracy demonstrators are refusing to move from Hong Kong's streets. Protesters were promised a free vote in 2017 elections. But the Chinese government has said the only candidates on the ballot would be vetted by a committee in Beijing. Seth Doane reports.

Title: Preview: Mommy Dearest
Description: All new: A Palm Beach socialite kills her ex-husband. Twenty years later, with the same gun, there's another shooting in the family. "48 Hours" correspondent Richard Schlesinger has the story Saturday, Oct. 4 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Inside Ann and John Bender's Costa Rican dream home
Description: What's it like to live in a home with no walls or windows on a mountaintop in the jungle? "48 Hours" correspondent Susan Spencer tours the ultimate open house -- the Benders' extravagant 50,000-square-foot home named Boracayan that's at the center of this week's "48 Hours."

Title: Sneak peek: Paradise Lost
Description: A husband shot dead in his Costa Rican paradise, his wife's murder conviction tossed out. Who killed the Wall Street millionaire? "48 Hours" correspondent Susan Spencer updates the case Saturday, July 25, 2015, at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Paradise Lost
Description: A Costa Rican paradise turns into a house of horror.  How did a Wall Street millionaire end up shot dead in his bedroom? Susan Spencer investigates in the season premiere of "48 Hours," Saturday, Sept. 27 at 10/9c on CBS.

Title: Rx excess: Millions of kids get unneeded prescriptions, study shows
Description: The American Academy of Pediatrics says antibiotics are being prescribed twice as often as they should for children with respiratory infections. Dr. Holly Phillips joins "CBS This Morning to discuss the estimated 11.4 million unnecessary yearly prescriptions.

Title: Preview: A Raging Son
Description: A Weight Watchers executive is murdered by her Wall Street lawyer boyfriend. Did his mother’s neglect 30 years ago push him to kill? Troy Roberts investigates Saturday, Sept. 20 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Forensic scientist in disbelief over Pistorius verdict
Description: Dr. David Klatzow, a specialist in forensic science, talks with CBS correspondent Debora Patta about the Oscar Pistorius verdict and his disappointment in the judge’s ruling.

Title: Criminal defense attorney: Pistorius team should celebrate verdict
Description: Criminal defense attorney and CNN Analyst Mark O'Mara explains how intent to kill played a part in the judge's verdict of culpable homicide in the Oscar Pistorius case.

Title: Pistorius friend: Verdict "a best-case scenario for Oscar"
Description: Jen Su, a friend of both Oscar Pistorius and Reeva Steenkamp, speaks with CBS News correspondent Debra Patta about the verdict and her belief that Oscar did not shoot with intent to kill Reeva.

Title: A rare look inside Oscar Pistorius' former home
Description: CBS News correspondent Debora Patta takes a tour through the former home of Oscar Pistorius, recounting the tragic events surrounding the shooting death of his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.

Title: Oscar Pistorius' ex-girlfriend on their roller-coaster romance
Description: Samantha Taylor and her mother, Trish Taylor, talk with CBS News correspondent Debora Patta to discuss Samantha's intense relationship with  Pistorius.

Title: Preview: Blade Runner: The Verdict
Description: Friday at 8:  What's next for Olympian Oscar Pistorius? A judge decides and a former girlfriend speaks out. "48 Hours" takes you into the courtroom Friday at 8 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Loved to Death
Description: She was a popular teen, her ex was a football star. Their breakup was intense - and she's dead. Ever hear of breakup violence? You will. Tracy Smith reports Saturday, Sept. 13 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: Death at Cottonwood Creek
Description: Did a loving wife slip and fall off a cliff while posing for a snapshot or did her husband want more than a good picture? Peter Van Sant investigates Saturday, Sept. 6 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: "48 Hours" season preview
Description: '48 Hours" -- the one to watch on Saturday night. Crime. Justice. Impact. A new season starts Saturday, Sept. 27 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: It's double the mystery Saturday, Sept. 6 starting at at 9 p.m. ET/PT:  A beautiful wife is suddenly dead. Would a twin really know if his brother was a killer?  Then at 10 p.m., did a loving wife slip and fall off a cliff while posing for a snapshot or did her husband want more than a good picture?

Title: Satellite images show Russian convoys on the move in Ukraine
Description: Satellite photos show convoys of Russian artillery moving inside Ukraine. Over the last 48 hours, Russia has opened another front in southeastern Ukraine where columns of Russian vehicles supported by artillery fire are advancing. David Martin reports.

Title: Experts question case against American in millionaire husband's death in Costa Rica
Description: The wife of a Wall Street millionaire is tried for murdering him at their extravagant home in  Costa Rica. Independent forensic experts investigate the scene and analyze the evidence.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: Saturday at 8 p.m. ET/PT: A detective is haunted by the case of two women missing for 30 years. Now she’s hot on the trail of a killer. Then at 10 p.m. ET/PT: A mother of three is found dead in a Colorado river. She had secrets -- did she name her own killer?

Title: Security cameras capture the last images of Mackenzie Cowell
Description: Watch the last known footage of Mackenzie Cowell as she leaves the Academy of Hair Design and walks to her car in Wenatchee, Wash., before her disappearance on Feb. 9, 2010. For more on the story, watch "Secrets of the the River", Saturday Aug. 9 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: Secrets of the River
Description: A high school dancer and aspiring model is found dead. Did the killer videotape the murder? Peter Van Sant reports Saturday, Aug. 9 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Secrets of the River
Description: A high school dancer and aspiring model is found dead. Did the killer videotape the murder? Peter Van Sant reports Saturday, Aug. 9 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: 48 Hours double feature
Description: Special time: Saturday at 8 p.m. ET/PT, an actress is dead and her preacher boyfriend prays for answers. Then at 10 p.m. ET/PT, three murders, three trials, 13 years of reporting by "48 Hours" and a husband and father walks free.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: Special time: Starting Saturday at 8 p.m. ET/PT, two women shot dead by a soldier. Can the Army convict one of its own? Then at 10 p.m. ET/PT, did going to confession cost a beauty queen her life? Richard Schlesinger updates both cases Saturday starting at 8 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: The Last Confession
Description: A beauty queen is found murdered. The prime suspect -- the priest who heard her confession. Richard Schlesinger reports Saturday, July 26 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: Coming up Saturday at 8 p.m. ET/PT: The head of security for a televangelist is threatened, his wife and sons are murdered. Who wanted this family dead? Then at 10 p.m., did a bookie gamble away everything -- including his wife's life?

Title: Preview: The Writing on the Wall
Description: SPECIAL TIME: The head of security for a televangelist is threatened, his wife and sons are murdered. Who wanted this family dead? Maureen Maher has the story Saturday, July 19 at 8 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek:  Murder at Sea?
Description: Devastated after the FBI bows out of the case, the family of missing cruise ship honeymooner George Smith vows to fight for answers.  "48 Hours" correspondent Richard Schlesinger has an update Saturday, July 5 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Greg Rozenberg questioned about Smith disappearance
Description: Greg Rozenberg was one of the last people to see George Smith alive. In 2010, attorney Mike Jones questioned Rozenberg in a Florida prison, where he was serving a sentence for trafficking oxycodone.

Title: Turkish police conduct shipboard interview after passenger disappears
Description: On the morning of July 5, 2005, Turkish police boarded the cruise ship Brilliance of the Seas to question Josh Askin, Rusty Kofman, Zach Rozenberg and Greg Rozenberg about the disappearance of George Smith. Dr. Jerald Askin, Josh's father, secretly recorded the interview. No one has ever been charged in connection with Smith's death.

Title: Missing Israeli teens found dead in West Bank
Description: The bodies of three missing Israeli teens were discovered under a pile of rocks north of the town of Halhul, near Hebron in the West Bank. The disappearance sparked a security crackdown. More than 400 were arrested and five Palestinians died in subsequent clashes. Holly Williams reports.

Title: Experts determine Pistorius was not suffering from mental disorder
Description: Psychiatrists determined Oscar Pistorius was not suffering from a mental illness when he killed girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp in his home last year. That's bad news for the defense, who had been hoping a diagnosis of an anxiety disorder would help his case. Deborah Patta reports.

Title: Preview: Lina's Heart
Description: A beautiful wife is suddenly dead. Would a twin really know if his brother was a killer? "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty investigates Saturday, July 5 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Paula Nixon's heroin journey
Description: Paula Nixon, 18, started using heroin when she was 16. Since then, she's been arrested and has survived several overdoses.

Title: Father of recovering heroin addict speaks out
Description: Jeff Lindbloom talks to "48 Hours" about son Jaymes' heroin addiction and the toll it's taken on their family. "My wife and I, have both cried, both prayed, both done everything we possibly can to give him the opportunity" to get clean.

Title: Sneak peek: The War in Chicago
Description: An honor student who marched in the Obama inaugural parade is shot dead on a Chicago street. A "48 Hours" investigation into drugs, guns, gangs and the battle for Chicago. Maureen Maher and Armen Keteyian report Saturday, June 28 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: Saturday at 9: An honor student who marched in the Obama inaugural parade is shot dead on a Chicago street. An investigation into drugs, guns, gangs and the battle for Chicago. At 10: Who wanted a one-time millionaire dead more: his ex-wife or his son?

Title: Sneak peek: The Perfect Family
Description: A mother's brutal murder reveals shocking family secrets. Tracy Smith reports Saturday, June 21 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: Saturday at 9/8c:  A perfect family is shattered by a mother's brutal murder. Then at 10: A heartbroken mother launches a one-woman psychological warfare campaign to taunt her daughter's alleged killer - but can she get him to crack?

Title: Oscar Pistorius trial: The ballistics evidence
Description: Dr. David Klatzow, a private forensic psychologist, talks to CBS News correspondent Debora Patta about the ballistics evidence presented by the prosecution and the defense in the Oscar Pistorius trial.

Title: Teacher recalls how a young Pistorius started running
Description: Pretoria Boys High School Headmaster Bill Schroder talks with CBS News correspondent Debora Patta about the event that prompted Oscar Pistorius, a "non athlete", to hit the track and witnessing his meteoric rise to fame.

Title: Pistorius teammate talks about their friendship
Description: Sprinter Samkelo Radebe was a member of the 2012 gold medal-winning 4x100 Paralympic Games relay team alongside Oscar Pistorius.  Radebe talks to CBS News correspondent Debora Patta about their record-breaking win and his recent conversation with Pistorius.

Title: Inside the Pistorius case: Animations bring defense, prosecution cases to life
Description: CBS News created animations to show what Oscar Pistorius says happened the night he shot his girlfriend, Reeva Steenkamp, as well as the very different story told by the prosecution.

Title: Longtime Pistorius friend now sketching Olympian's murder trial
Description: Jaco Van Vuuren, a friend of Oscar Pistorius for more that 10 years on the running track, surprised the Olympic star at his murder trial with a hidden talent: courtroom sketching.

Title: Nicole Brown Simpson's sister speaks out
Description: It's been 20 years since the murder of her sister, but Tanya Brown tells "48 Hours" she still remembers the infamous Bronco chase and the O.J. Simpson trial like it was yesterday.

Title: OJ Simpson trial: "First reality stars" still in the spotlight
Description: From the Kardashians and Kato Kaelin to the infamous white Ford Bronco, Vanity Fair writer Lili Anolik looks back on the curious cast of characters still in the spotlight 20 years after the O.J. Simpson trial.

Title: "Life is not going to be the same" for Pistorius say family friends
Description: In his first American TV interview, Mike Azzie, known to Oscar Pistorius as "Uncle Mike," and his son, Adam, reflect on their 14-year friendship with the Olympic star charged in shooting death of girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp.

Title: Oscar Pistorius' blade maker: Inside his Arkansas workshop
Description: Thousands of miles from his native South Africa, Francois Van Der Watt, the man who designed the blades that propelled sprinter Oscar Pistorius to capture his dreams, gives "48 Hours"' Peter Van Sant an inside look at his Fort Smith prosthetics workshop.

Title: Sneak peek: Oscar Pistorius: Shots in the Dark
Description: Olympic hero Oscar Pistorius shot his girlfriend -- is he a murderer? His closest family friend speaks out in an all-new "48 Hours" airing Monday, June 16 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Oscar Pistorius: Shots in the Dark
Description: Olympic hero Oscar Pistorius shot his girlfriend -- is he a murderer? His closest family friend speaks out in an all-new "48 Hours" airing Monday, June 16 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: The Devil's Twin
Description: A young mother is dead and identical twin brothers are the suspects. Did studying TV crime shows help them come close to pulling off the perfect crime? Erin Moriarty reports Saturday, June 14 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Family: Silence spoke volumes after Michele Harris' disappearance
Description: On Sept. 12, 2001, the day Michele Harris disappeared, Greg and Shannon Taylor, her brother and sister-in-law, say they knew instantly that Michele's husband, Cal Harris, had killed her. What tipped them  off?

Title: How jurors in Cal Harris' first trial reached a verdict
Description: On June 7, 2007, jurors in Cal Harris' first trial for the murder of his wife, Michele, reached a verdict that stunned the courtroom. They talk to "48 Hours" about how they reached their decision.

Title: Cal Harris, children appeal for answers in 2001 disappearance
Description: In March, Cal Harris spoke at a press conference about the 2001 disappearance of his wife, Michele. He had been convicted twice for her murder. Both verdicts were overturned. His children joined him in his appeal for information about their mother.

Title: Sneak peek: The Trials of Cal Harris
Description: Special night: Facing a third trial for killing his wife, a wealthy New York businessman gives his first interview to "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty. Watch Monday, June 9 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: The Trials of Cal Harris
Description: Special night: Facing a third trial for killing his wife, a wealthy New York businessman gives his first interview to "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty. Watch Monday, June 9 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: The Trials of Cal Harris
Description: Special night: Facing a third trial for killing his wife, a wealthy New York businessman gives first interview to "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty. Watch Monday, June 9 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Hollywood Secrets
Description: Saturday at 10:  An aspiring actress is brutally strangled in her Santa Monica, Calif., home. DNA was left all over the crime scene... leading police to a surprising suspect. Maureen Maher reports June 7 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Pat Sessions remembers daughter Tiffany
Description: After Tiffany Sessions disappeared 25 years ago, her father, Patrick, has always fought to keep her memory alive. He shares some of his favorite photos of Tiffany with "48 Hours"' Tracy Smith and reflects on the pain of losing someone you love. For more on his efforts to find Tiffany, watch "The Lost Daughter," Saturday, Aug. 8 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Tiffany Sessions: A friend to animals
Description: Growing up, Tiffany Sessions was the quintessential animal lover. Her mother, Hilary Sessions, looks back on her daughter's love for animals and her equestrian achievements. For more, watch "The Lost Daughter," Saturday, Aug. 8 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: We're filming in the rain: Behind the scenes with "48 Hours"
Description: Some unexpected rain doesn't have to put a damper on a day's work. "48 Hours" associate producer Aimee deSimone offers a look behind-the-scenes. For more, watch "The Lost Daughter" Saturday, Aug. 8 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Attack survivor Melissa Dohme thanks her heroes
Description: Melissa Dohme is forever grateful for the efforts of the team that saved her life. After her recovery, she made it her mission to personally thank everyone involved.

Title: Detectives investigate the attack on Melissa Dohme
Description: On Jan. 24, 2012, Robert Burton was found slumped over the wheel of his truck. He had attempted suicide after stabbing his former girlfriend, Melissa Dohme. Detectives Tom Dawe and Joseph Ruhlin walk "48 Hours" through the investigation and the evidence.

Title: Preview: The Lost Daughter
Description: Special night: A college student missing for 25 years -- has a Florida sheriff's office solved one of the state's biggest mysteries? Tracy Smith reports in all-new "48 Hours" Monday, June 2 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: The Lost Daughter
Description: A college student missing for 25 years -- has a Florida sheriff’s office solved one of the state’s biggest mysteries? Tracy Smith reports Saturday, Aug. 8 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: One Last Hug
Description: "48 Hours" Live to Tell: A woman survives a brutal attack to find true love -- the real story of a survivor and the hero EMT that helped save her life and more. Watch Tuesday, June 16 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: One Last Hug
Description: 48 Hours Live to Tell: A breakup, one last hug. Was a college student walking into her own murder? All new Saturday at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: "I loved her," convicted killer tells "48 Hours"
Description: Hear more of "48 Hours" correspondent Maureen Maher’s interview with Steve DeMocker, his reaction to the evidence against him and the jury’s verdict.

Title: “We may need every penny of it" DeMocker says of insurance money
Description: In a jail house call recorded by authorities, murder suspect Steve DeMocker and his daughter, Katie, argue over how to use the proceeds of her murdered mother's life insurance.

Title: DeMocker's ex- girlfriend raises suspicion
Description: In an exclusive interview with "48 Hours," Steve DeMocker’s ex-girlfriend, Renee Girard, talks about Steve's odd behavior the day of Carol Kennedy’s murder.

Title: Tracking the trail of footprints outside murder victim's home
Description: The footprints behind Carol Kennedy’s home were a significant piece of evidence for the prosecution in the case against Steven DeMocker. Rich Robertson, a private investigator for the defense, explains the process of tracking footprints in the trails behind the crime scene.

Title: Steve DeMocker questioned about death of ex-wife
Description: Detectives bring in Steve DeMocker for questioning within hours of finding the body of his ex-wife, Carol Kennedy.

Title: Carol Kennedy's sanctuary
Description: Kennedy was known in Prescott, Arizona as an artist. Her friends talk about how much she enjoyed her time in their art studio.

Title: Sneak peek: Redemption Song
Description: "48 Hours" Presents: A music producer is convicted of murder after 26 years. Case closed? Not by a long shot. Tracy Smith updates the case Saturday, May 24 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: End of the Trail
Description: Special night: A key witness in the murder case against an Arizona stockbroker accused of killing his ex-wife speaks out on network television for the first time in an interview with "48 Hours." Maureen Maher has the story Monday, May 26 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: End of the Trail
Description: Special time: A key witness in the murder case against an Arizona stockbroker accused of killing his ex-wife speaks out on network television for the first time in an interview with "48 Hours." Maureen Maher has the story Saturday, Feb.  28 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours Presents" double feature
Description: Coming up Saturday, May  24 at 9 p.m. ET/PT:  Can a childhood memory of a friend's murder solve a 55-year-old cold case?  Then at 10:  A music producer is convicted of murder after 26 years.  Case closed? Not by a long shot.

Title: Murder victim's sisters remain suspicious
Description: Jessica Montoya and Antoinette Curran, the sisters of murder victim Bernadette Ohlemacher, voice their lingering concerns regarding their niece’s possible involvement in her parents' deaths.

Title: What will Renee Ohlemacher's polygraph reveal?
Description: Police had long cleared Renee in the 2005 murders of her parents, but in a surprising move in 2012, a prosecutor working the case asked her to take a polygraph.

Title: Cops question murder suspect at hospital
Description: On June 14 2006, Det. Mike Fox and Secret Service Agent Brian Nguyen went to Presbyterian Kaseman Hospital in Albuquerque where suspect Ron Santiago, a mortgage loan processor, was undergoing psychiatric treatment. Fox and Nguyen questioned Santiago for approximately two hours about his possible involvement with the murders of Greg and Bernadette Ohlemacher, who’d been gunned down in their home on Aug. 2, 2005. Santiago’s lawyers later said at his murder trial that he had been given several medications before the questioning. Prosecutors countered by saying that Santiago’s doctor said there were no medical restrictions on him being questioned.  These are excerpts from that interview.

Title: Murder victim’s brother and father speak out
Description: Randy and Jack Ohlemacher break down remembering the murders of Greg and wife Bernadette, and their relationship with their estranged niece, Renee, during an interview with "48 Hours"' Erin Moriarty.

Title: Sneak peek: A Daughter, a Mortgage and Two Murders
Description: A couple killed, a daughter suspected -- could a mortgage application lead to the killer? "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty investigates Saturday, Aug. 15 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: A Daughter, a Mortgage and Two Murders
Description: New: A couple killed, a daughter suspected -- could a mortgage application lead to the killer? Erin Moriarty investigates Saturday, May 17 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: Saturday at 9: Two murdered teens - 32 years to get justice -- and eight years of reporting by "48 Hours." Then new at 10: A couple killed, a daughter suspected -- could a mortgage application lead to the killer? Erin Moriarty reports.

Title: Jason Bohn talks about his anger issues
Description: Dr. Jennifer Rosner, a forensic psychologist hired by the prosecution, interviewed Jason Bohn for eight hours on three separate occasions. Bohn explains to Dr. Rosner that his anger issues stemmed from childhood.

Title: Jason Bohn discusses Danielle Thomas
Description: In an interview with Dr. Jennifer Rosner, a forensic psychologist hired by the prosecution, Jason Bohn talks about his love for Danielle Thomas.

Title: Forensic psychiatrist on understanding the criminal mind
Description: Dr. Alexander Sasha Bardey is a Harvard-educated forensic psychiatrist and a consultant for the TV show "Law & Order: SVU". A defense expert in the Jason Bohn case, Bardey talks about his fascination with trying to understand why someone commits a crime.

Title: Michael Wolfe: "I'm taking the fall for everybody"
Description: In his only jailhouse interview and in chilling detail, Michael Wolfe tells "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts about what really happened to David Jackson the night he disappeared.

Title: Detective on Michael Wolfe's account of events
Description: Detective Donna Velazquez, of the Pembroke Pines, Fla., Police Dept., shows "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts the motel where Michael Wolfe says David Jackson was murdered and tells Roberts why she believes Wolfe's story.

Title: Audio: John Wolfe's interview with detectives
Description: It was just a regular day for Police Explorer John Wolfe at the police station -- until he recognized his father in a missing persons poster. Listen to this audio recording of Wolfe telling investigators he believes his own mother knows more than she says about his dad's disappearance.

Title: Remembering "Hometown Girl" Danielle Thomas
Description: "48 Hours" talks with Danielle Thomas' hometown friend Amanda Hale and high school band director Tim Blevins, who fondly remember her. Find out what's being done to keep Danielle's passion for music alive.

Title: Sneak peek: A Raging Son
Description: A Weight Watchers executive is murdered by her Wall Street lawyer boyfriend.  Did his mother's neglect 30 years ago push him to kill? "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts investigates  Saturday, Aug. 13 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: 48 Hours double feature
Description: Saturday at 9: A son helps a new detective find his father's killer. Then all-new at 10: A Weight Watchers executive is murdered by her Wall Street lawyer boyfriend. Did his mother's neglect 30 years ago push him to kill? Troy Roberts reports.

Title: Preview: A Raging Son
Description: All new: A Weight Watchers executive is murdered by her Wall Street lawyer boyfriend.  Did his mother’s neglect 30 years ago push him to kill? Troy Roberts investigates Saturday, May 10 at 10 p.m . ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Murder suspect Michele Williams has history of deceit say sons
Description: Lee and Andrew O'Brien talk to "48 Hours" about their mother's relationship with their former best friend, their distrust of women and what they really think happened that October night when Greg Williams was shot to death in his home.

Title: Sister on murder suspect Michele Williams' odd behavior
Description: Laura, sister of Michele Williams, talks to "48 Hours" about how Michele acted in the aftermath of husband Greg Williams' shooting death.

Title: Wysh Project aims to help prevent suicides in the military
Description: After a traumatic childhood and tour of duty in Iraq, Andrew O'Brien, Michele Williams' youngest son, attempted suicide. Andrew talks to "48 Hours" about how he is using his experiences to help fellow soldiers and their families.

Title: Taylor Williams: "I lost my protector"
Description: Greg William's eldest daughter talks about her dad and reads a poem she wrote in his honor.

Title: Sneak peek: Temptation in Texas
Description: All new: Was a brilliant businessman with a taste for bondage killed by an intruder, someone he loved or his own hand? "48 Hours"' Peter Van Sant investigates Saturday, May 3 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Temptation in Texas
Description: All new: Sex, bondage, affairs and murder - who killed a brilliant-but-feared businessman? "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant reports Saturday, May 3 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Band mates open up about rocker, murder suspect
Description: Jim Huden’s former band mates talk to "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant about what it was like to find out their one-time lead guitarist was accused of murder.

Title: Remembering Russel Douglas
Description: Gail O'Neil shares memories of her son, Russel Douglas, who was murdered on Sept. 26, 2003, on Whidbey Island, Wash.

Title: Suspects surprised with simultaneous, separate interrogations
Description: Detectives allege Jim Huden and Peggy Thomas lured Russel Douglas to his death by asking to drop off a present for Russel’s wife, Brenna. Both Jim and Peggy claim the present was delivered to Russel days before the murder. When investigators surprise their suspects with simultaneous separate interrogations, they discover discrepancies. Do you think Jim and Peggy are making up a story to throw off investigators?

Title: Why Ann Rule was intrigued with the Russel Douglas murder case
Description: The true-crime author of over two dozen New York Times bestsellers tells "48 Hours" she couldn't help but write about the Russel Douglas case.

Title: Sneak peek: Dangerous Beauty
Description: How did a former beauty queen end up at the heart of a murder case? "48 Hours" correspondent Peter Van Sant investigates Saturday, June 27 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Weidner family remembers Amy, honors Det. Carter
Description: Cassie Gardner, Amy Weidner's younger sister, honors Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Det. Sgt. William Carter with a poem she wrote as the Weidner's family and friends gather for a celebration decades in the making.

Title: Rodney Denk questioned by police
Description: Rodney Denk cut his wrist during his arrest for the 1989 murder of Amy Weidner. He was taken to the hospital for treatment, where he was interviewed by police over the course of two days.

Title: Man's best friend helps track and find the missing
Description: Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Det. Sgt. William Carter talks with "48 Hours" about his bloodhound, Grace, and how she tracks missing people as an unofficial public safety dog. For more on Carter and a decades-old cold case, watch "48 Hours: Decades of Deceit", Saturday, April 19 at 10/9c on CBS .

Title: Sneak peek: Decades of Deceit
Description: Can a Facebook-savvy investigator solve the case of a mom murdered two decades ago?  "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts reports Saturday, Aug. 22 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Decades of Deceit
Description: All new: Can a Facebook-savvy investigator solve a two-decade old case of a murdered mom? "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts reports Saturday, April 19 at 10 p.m ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Remembering Angel Downs
Description: Tanya McGowin talks to "48 Hours" about her friendship with Angel Downs and her feelings about Stephen Nodine.

Title: Stephen Nodine maintains innocence in death of mistress
Description: "48 Hours"' Richard Schlesinger questions Nodine about his affair with Angel Downs. Nodine admits to being selfish and self-centered in leading a double life, but denies he killed her.

Title: Police body cameras offer view of crime scene
Description: See what police in Gulf Shores, Ala., saw as they arrived outside of Angel Downs' condo the night of May 9, 2010. The  real estate agent, 45, was found dead in her own driveway from a single gunshot to the head -- fired from her own weapon.

Title: "I heard a gunshot" witness tells Gulf Shores police
Description: Firefighter Roger Whitehead and other neighbors tell Gulf Shores, Ala., police what they saw and heard in the area near Angel Downs' home the night of May 9, 2010. Downs was discovered dead in her driveway from a gunshot to the head. The conversations were recorded by police wearing body cameras.

Title: Emotional encounter between father and son captured on cell phone
Description: Audio: When Pelle Wall became convinced that his father, Johnny, murdered his mother, Uta, the teen severed all ties with his dad. Hear what happened months later during a heated face-to-face confrontation.

Title: Did politics play role in prosecution of Stephen Nodine?
Description: "48 Hours"' Richard Schlesinger questions former Baldwin County D.A. Judy Newcomb and her successor, current D.A. Hallie Dixon, about how each handled the case against Stephen Nodine, a Mobile County commissioner who was charged with murdering his mistress, Angel Downs in May 2010.

Title: "48 Hours" behind the scenes
Description: In "48 Hours"' "Father and Son," a Utah mother is found dead in her bathtub. Because water plays a significant part in this story, producers used a Photron high-speed video camera to capture unique shots of running and dripping water which were then used as creative graphic elements in the show.

Title: Nils Abramson's shocking discovery
Description: On the evening of Tuesday, Sept. 27, 2011, Uta von Schwedler's boyfriend went to her home expecting a quiet night together. Instead, Nils Abramson discovered his girlfriend dead in her own bathtub. Abramson takes "48 Hours" through Uta's home and explains what he experienced that night.

Title: Sneak peek: Father and Son
Description: All new: Can a son's shocking discovery about his father prove his mom's death wasn't a suicide? "48 Hours"' Susan Spencer investigates Saturday, April 12 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Father and Son
Description: All new: Can a son's shocking discovery about his father prove his mom's death wasn't a suicide? Susan Spencer investigates Saturday, April 12 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: 48 Hours double feature
Description: Saturday starting at 9 p.m.ET/PT: A powerful politician, a forbidden affair - did he love her to death? Richard Schlesinger has the story in "Power and Passion". Then all new at 10: Can a son's shocking discovery about his father prove his mom's death wasn't a suicide? Susan Spencer investigates in "Father and Son".

Title: Dancing with former defense attorney Diana Tennis
Description: Caryn Kelley's former defense attorney talks about what she loves to do outside of the courtroom and gives a glimpse into her background in dance and theatre.

Title: Forensics aim to prove how Phillip Peatross was shot
Description: To determine if Philip Peatross' death was a suicide or homicide, Orlando Chief Medical Examiner Dr. Jan Garavaglia and forensic scientist Matt Conway need to know the distance the gun barrel was from Peatross' face.  In this demonstration for "48 Hours", they explain how gun tests are conducted to determine that distance.

Title: Accident or suicide? 911 call gives different versions of shooting
Description: In her call to 911 on July 27, 2011, Caryn Kelley first tells the operator a shooting at her Orlando home was an accident and then says Phillip Peatross actually put the gun to his head.

Title: Caryn Kelley finds out her boyfriend is dead
Description: Interrogation video: Kelley reacts after learning from an Orlando police officer that her boyfriend, Phillip Peatross, has died after a shooting in her home. "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts has more on the story,  Saturday, June 13 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: What happened inside Caryn Kelley's bedroom?
Description: Interrogation video: Suspicious of her story, Orlando police officers continue to question Kelley about how her boyfriend  was shot dead inside her bedroom the night of July 27, 2011. "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts has more on the story Saturday, June 13 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Caryn Kelley realizes she may be a suspect in death of boyfriend
Description: Interrogation video: After hearing multiple versions of Kelley's story, Orlando officers give her the Miranda warning.  "48 Hours"' Troy Roberts has more on the story in "Wounded  by Love," airing Saturday, June 13 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Cell phone video captures raw emotion after fatal shooting
Description: Orlando police question Caryn Kelley minutes after her boyfriend, Phillip Peatross, was shot in her bedroom on July 27, 2011. Will the controversial video be enough to clear or convict her?

Title: Sneak peek: Wounded by Love
Description: A lover is shot dead - will cell phone video recorded in the aftermath be enough to clear or convict? Troy Roberts reports Saturday, June 13 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Wounded by Love
Description: All new: A lover is shot dead - will cell phone video clear or convict? Troy Roberts reports Saturday, April 5 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Death row inmate's letter to teen reveals surprise
Description: When Josh Thibodeaux was 14 he got a letter out of the blue from the father he never knew. Here he talks about his reaction to that letter and what it was like to finally meet his dad in person for the first time.

Title: Damon Thibodeaux: "I have officially rejoined the world - it’s a beautiful thing"
Description: In April 2013, seven months after walking off of death row, Damon Thibodeaux was invited to speak at an Innocence Project event in New York.

Title: Damon Thibodeaux on his newfound freedom
Description: Hours after his release in September 2012, Damon Thibodeaux spoke to the press about what it was like to walk free after 15 years on death row.

Title: Did one man's dream lead him to a missing girl's body?
Description: Damon Thibodeaux was sent to death row for the 1996 murder of Louisiana teen Crystal Champagne, but hear to what the man who found the 14-year-old's body had to say. John Tomlinson tells "48 Hours"' Erin Moriarty what led him to look for Crystal in a place no one else had been searching. Watch "Last Chance"  Saturday at 10/9c on CBS.

Title: Angola prison has a gift shop?
Description: You might be as surprised as "48 Hours" producers were to discover that Louisiana State Penitentiary in Angola, one of the most notorious prisons in the U.S. has a place to buy souvenirs.  Take a look inside.

Title: Sneak peek: Last Chance
Description: SPECIAL TIME: Why would a man confess to killing his 14-year-old cousin if he didn't do it? "48 Hours"' Erin Moriarty investigates Saturday, Dec. 6 at 8 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: Ryan Ferguson @LifeAfterTen
Description: Wrongly convicted of murder and finally free, can Ryan Ferguson put his life back together? "48 Hours"' Erin Moriarty reports, Saturday, March 29 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: "48 Hours" double feature
Description: Saturday at 9 p.m. ET/PT, wrongly convicted of murder and finally free, can Ryan Ferguson put his life back together? Then at 10, why would a man confess to killing his 14-year-old cousin if he didn't do it?  Two men, two questionable convictions. Erin Moriarty investigates.

Title: Preview: Last Chance
Description: All new: Why would a man confess to killing his 14-year-old cousin if he didn't do it?  "48 Hours"' Erin Moriarty investigates Saturday, March 29 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Sneak peek: aka Rockefeller
Description: He's posed as a producer, a trader, a baronet, a Rockefeller. Was a conman hiding a murder along with his identity? Erin Moriarty reports Saturday, March 22 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: William Hurst denies killing wife Amy
Description: Murder suspect William Hurst continues to profess his innocence in the 1982 disappearance of his wife  during an interview with Det. Lisa Schoneman and Capt. Craig Patterson on July 28, 2011.

Title: William Hurst questioned about wife's 1982 disappearance
Description: Wearing a wire, Det. Lisa Schoneman, with Capt. Craig Patterson, confronts murder suspect William Hurst about the disappearance of his wife, Amy, 30 years ago. Hear Hurst's claims that he had nothing to do with it and the detective's skillful efforts to get to the truth.

Title: Preview: aka Rockefeller
Description: The final chapter of the amazing "Clark Rockefeller" story. The con man and accused killer faces off with "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty Saturday, March 22 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Newborn endangered kangaroo emerges from mother's pouch
Description: Zookeepers at Sydney's Taronga Zoo finally got a glimpse of the newborn Goodfellow's tree kangaroo after nine months of waiting. The endangered species has the longest pregnancy term of any marsupial - 45 days. The mother, called Qwikia by her carers, gave birth on September 4, 2013, but this was the first time the baby began to peep out from his mother's pouch.

Title: Beloved keepsake helps solve 30-year murder mystery
Description: "48 Hours" correspondent Susan Spencer describes key evidence that led investigators to close in on a suspect in a 1982 Florida cold case.

Title: Sneak peek: Fateful Connection
Description: A detective is haunted by the case of two women missing for 30 years – now she’s hot on the trail of a killer. Susan Spencer reports Saturday, Aug. 16  at 8 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Preview: Fateful Connection
Description: All new: A detective is haunted by the case of two women missing for 30 years -- now she's hot on the trail of a killer. Susan Spencer reports Saturday, March 15 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: In her own voice: Stephanie Roller's testimony
Description: One of the most moving pieces of evidence presented against Dale Bruner when he was tried for murdering his wife, Stephanie Roller, was the voice of Stephanie herself. Stephanie was recorded just six weeks before her murder when she requested a restraining order against her husband.

Title: Remembering Stephanie Roller
Description: Stephanie Roller's older sister, Ramona, remembers happy times growing up and Stephanie's passion for dance.

Title: How to help a victim of domestic violence
Description: Amy Jackson, the director of Summit County Colorado Advocates for Victims of Assault, was a key witness in the prosecution's case against Dale Bruner. Here she outlines some of the most common myths and misconceptions about domestic violence and explains what kind of help works best.

Title: The search for Stephanie Roller
Description: When Stephanie Roller went "missing" on Thanksgiving week of November 2010, scores of volunteers showed up to search for her. Glen Kraatz and Shari Topping of the Summit County Colorado Rescue Group explain how they worked to find her and the factors involved in a search in the rugged Rocky Mountain high country.

Title: Detective on Dale Bruner questioning: "Something was wrong"
Description: When Stephanie Roller went "missing" in November 2010, Silverthorne Police Det. Theresa Barger brought Stephanie's husband, Dale Bruner, in for questioning twice. Barger tells" 48 Hours" what she took away from those interviews.

Title: Sneak peek: The Blue River Murder
Description: A mother of three is found dead. She had secrets -- did she name her own killer? Tracy Smith reports Saturday, Aug.  16 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Former priest:  "I am not the man who killed Irene Garza"
Description: In 2003, at the request of law enforcement, former monk Dale Tacheny was asked to call former priest John Feit. Tacheny has said that in 1963, when the two were in a monastery together, Feit told Tacheny he had killed a young woman. Hear excerpts from that call recorded by law enforcement.

Title: Behind the scenes with "48 Hours" composer Richard Fiocca
Description: Richard Fiocca collaborates with the Boston-based handbell choir "The Back Bay Ringers" to create a score of music to be used throughout "The Last Confession". Get an inside look at the day of the performance.

Title: Sneak peek: The Last Confession
Description: A beauty queen is found murdered. The prime suspect -- the priest who heard her confession. Richard Schlesinger reports Saturday, July 26 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Prosecutor on the Sun Gym gang's kidnapping plot
Description: Prosecutor Gail Levine talks to "48 Hours" about how Daniel Lugo and Adrian Doorbal tricked Frank Griga by presenting themselves as investors in order to close in on the millionaire and his girlfriend.

Title: Judge Alex Ferrer: "The jurors in this case were my heroes"
Description: Judge Ferrer explains how and why this case was so complicated and shares with "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts how difficult it was to prosecute.

Title: Miami-Dade state attorney on seeking justice for victims
Description: Katherine Fernandez Rundle talks to "48 Hour" correspondent Troy Roberts about the importance of getting justice for the victims of the Sun Gym gang and the difficult time Miami faced during the early 1990s.

Title: Judge Alex Ferrer: "I was shocked at the level they went to"
Description: Judge Ferrer talks to "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts about the grave danger Marc Schiller was in after his escape from members of the Sun Gym gang.

Title: TV's "Judge Alex" on his early life, career in Miami
Description: Judge Alex Ferrer talks about his roots, his early days in Miami and how a stint as a cop launched his legal career.

Title: Lugo and Doorbal's "assassins kit"
Description: Retired Miami-Dade detectives show the arsenal of weapons and other tools they say Daniel Lugo and Adrian Doorbal used to murder millionaire Frank Griga and his girlfriend, Krisztina Furton.

Title: Sneak peek: Muscle and Mayhem
Description: A gang of bodybuilders hatch a plan to kidnap and kill wealthy people -- "48 Hours" correspondent Troy Roberts has the real story that inspired a Hollywood movie. Watch Saturday, Feb. 22 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Pastor who died handling snakes was bitten at least eight times before
Description: A snake handler and church leader in Kentucky died after being bit during a religious ceremony. CBS News' Marlie Hall reports on the pastor and how he met his death.

Title: Preview: Muscle and Mayhem
Description: Bodybuilders plan to kidnap and kill wealthy people. It's a true story and a Hollywood movie. Correspondent Troy Roberts reports Saturday, Feb. 22 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Poker pro Brian Rast  on gambling for a living
Description: "I chose poker for freedom," professional poker player Brian Rast told "48 Hours." The Las Vegas-based player talks about the lure and mystique of the game and why poker players are like small businesses.

Title: Ernie Scherer interrogation excerpts
Description: Scherer is questioned by investigators on March 18, 2008, following the murder of his parents.

Title: Budding musicians gear up to march in Mardi Gras
Description: While thousands gear up to party for Mardi Gras, New Orleans marching band students prepare for an endurance test.  "The Whole Gritty City," a film documenting music and survival in New Orleans, airs Saturday at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: A young musician is tapped for the Mardi Gras spotlight
Description: Can a budding musician lead his marching band during Mardi Gras?  "The Whole Gritty City," a film documenting music and survival in New Orleans, airs Saturday at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: How a crime scene investigator keeps her sons safe
Description: Officer Shelita Haynes with the New Orleans P.D. Crime Scene Unit responds to  shootings nearly every night.  Many of the victims are around the same age as her teenage sons, Jerome and Jamal.  But Officer Haynes finds comfort knowing her sons are in the L.E. Rabouin High School Marching Band.  Within the walls of the band room there is safety from the streets. For more, watch "48 Hours Presents: the Whole Gritty City" Saturday, Feb.15 at 9/8c on CBS.

Title: A band leader's take on the drug dealers' dress code
Description: Band director Wilbert Rawlins knows he's competing with drug dealers for the hearts and minds of his students, so he found a creative way to make a big impression. Watch "48 Hours Presents: the Whole Gritty City" Saturday, Feb.15 at 9/8c on CBS.

Title: Behind the lens:  A dangerous world from a child's point of view
Description: "The Whole Gritty City" has some unusual cinematographers. Filmmakers Richard Barber and Andre Lambertson gave digital cameras to some of their young subjects.  The result is an intimate look at a dangerous world from a child's point of view.  One boy narrates his walk to school, "This is the street I don't like, 'cause it has guns." Watch "48 Hours Presents: the Whole Gritty City" Saturday, Feb.15 at 9/8c on CBS.

Title: Trailer: The Whole Gritty City
Description: "The Whole Gritty City", airing Saturday, Feb. 15 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS, follows three New Orleans marching bands. The bands' directors do more than prepare students to march in Mardi Gras parades: they battle for their lives and souls against the lures and dangers of the streets.

Title: I'm with the band: L.E. Rabouin H.S. Marching Falcons
Description: Go behind the scenes as the L.E. Rabouin High School Marching Band rehearses before a Mardi Gras parade. Director Lonzie Jackson demands excellence from the band, flag team and cheerleaders. For more, watch "48 Hours Presents: the Whole Gritty City" Saturday, Feb.15 at 9/8c on CBS.

Title: No drums? No problem!  New Orleans kids play on
Description: Four months before The Roots of Music Marching Band started it's very first Mardi Gras parade season, students didn't even have all their instruments. But that didn't stop band founder Derrick Tabb from teaching his young musicians how to play drums. For more, watch "48 Hours Presents: the Whole Gritty City" Saturday, Feb.15 at 9/8c on CBS.

Title: NOLA marching band instructor: Never say "I can't"
Description: A young student struggles to play his horn in the Roots of Music Marching Band.  Instructor Edward Lee has patience for every sour note, but there are consequences when the student says "I can't." For more, watch "48 Hours Presents: the Whole Gritty City" Saturday, Feb.15 at 9/8c on CBS.

Title: Lend me your ears: A trumpet lesson
Description: Wilbert Rawlins, director of the O. Perry Walker H.S. Marching Band, patiently helps a student learn to play a trumpet part.  Ear plugs not included. For more, watch "48 Hours Presents: the Whole Gritty City" Saturday, Feb.15 at 9/8c on CBS.

Title: Preview: The Country Club Murders
Description: A professional poker player is under suspicion for the brutal murder of his parents. Peter Van Sant reports Saturday, Feb. 8 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Description: A professional poker player is under suspicion for the brutal murder of his parents. Peter Van Sant reports Saturday, Feb. 8 at 10 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: Attack survivor speaks out for first time
Description: The woman attacked by Bobby Jack Fowler in a motel room in Newport, Ore., in 2001, recounts her harrowing ordeal in a telephone interview with "48 Hours". Fowler was convicted of attacking her in 2006, and it led to him being suspected as a possible serial killer along the Highway of Tears.

Title: CBC producer's personal connection to Highway of Tears victims
Description: Canadian Broadcasting's Robert Doane remembers two of the young women he knew personally, who went missing along the Highway of Tears. He also explains why so many hitchhike along the highway.

Title: Remembering Highway of Tears victim Colleen MacMillen
Description: Kevin and Shawn MacMillen discuss the emotional journey of wondering what happened to their sister, Colleen, who went missing in 1974, along the Highway of Tears. In Sept. 2012 -- 38 years after her disappearance -- they finally learned that her killer had been caught.

Title: Sister of Highway of Tears victim on letting go of guilt

Description: To the families of murder victims John Riggins and Sabrina Gonsalves, journalist and author Joel Davis is an unsung hero. They credit his investigative work with putting pressure on the criminal justice system to close this case. "48 Hours"'Troy Roberts reports on a man who dedicated years to this murder mystery despite some overwhelming obstacles.

Title: Sneak peek: The Sweetheart Murders
Description: Two murdered teens, 32 years to get justice, and eight years of reporting by "48 Hours". Troy Roberts has the latest in the investigation, Saturday, May 17 at 9 p.m. ET/PT on CBS.

Title: 1980 police video of "sweetheart murders" crime scene
Description:
When teens John Riggins and Sabrina Gonsalves were murdered in December 1980, the case marked the first time the Sacramento Sheriff's Dept. videotaped a crime scene. Carol Daly, then one of only a handful of female homicide detectives on the force, was behind the camera. Title: Murder victim's sister speaks to "48 Hours"
Description:
In 2002, a match on DNA left at the scene of a 1980 murder would point to a teen couple's killer. But the case was far from over. The families of Sabrina Gonsalves and John Riggins would wait another 10 years before the killer was tried. Gonsalves' sister, Andrea Rosenstein, described her search for justice to "48 Hours". Title: Man falsely accused in 1980 murder calls accusation an "outrage"
Description:
